name: Tetra
info: A Sinner who is adept at breaking Cores. Deals Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
maniaIntensifyText: Upon breaking a Core, all allied Sinners gain 20% CRIT for 10 seconds.
criminalRecord:
One half of the phantom robber duo Fox and Rabbit, the subject goes by the code name //Fox//. Ignoring her own duties and obligations as an elite in society, the subject imitated another thief's method and colluded with the thief to commit theft using advanced technology.

The subject mostly stole from the residences of major officials and corporate leaders in Eastside, posing a great threat to the upper class's interests. The subject even allegedly stole classified information from the EDGE, resulting in leaks of top-secret information and obstructing the city's development.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary
Able to stop time for a subjective duration of several seconds. The subject can move freely during this period. Extremely high battle effectiveness can be achieved when equipped with her specifically designed iron claw weapon.

+++* Awakening Signs
Had an awakening at the //Robber Rabbit//'s theft crime scene. Examination showed that the awakening was triggered by overzealous emotions. As awakening cases caused by positive emotions are rare, details are still to be further confirmed.

+++* Corruption State
The corruption level is low with no apparent physical signs of corruption and a fairly stable mental state. But the time-stopping duration record continues to be broken and the harmful effects of consistent enhancement through special powers to the body remain unknown at the moment.
ecbFlavourText:
"My dear, it is so sad to see you all alone on that terrace. I brought along some friends with me."
"See you again then, if fate permits."
arrestRec1: Snuck into the MBCC with accomplices and intended to steal property information from the Chief's office using their special power. Security discovered the subject's escape trail in time and a close investigation resulted in the subject's detainment.
servingTerm1: The subject has provided the Bureau with a lot of effective legal, financial, and managerial assistance, though only in the form of consultation. Due to the subject's family background, the subject has no real-life work experience and is not fully confident in the practical execution of orders.
servingTerm2: Out of habit, the subject follows the DisCity's change of regulations closely and can even accurately predict the government's actions. But with high awareness of confidentiality, unless something threatens the safety of innocent civilians, the subject will not easily reveal personal political opinions to the MBCC.
servingTerm3: Most Sinners find Tetra friendly, talkative, and well-mannered. But the MBCC observes that the subject never has deep conversations with any Sinners and will leave immediately after interacting with every Sinner for 30 seconds at group social events.
servingTerm4:
The subject once gave the Chief a specifically designed hourglass whose sand flows extremely slowly and does not change direction when flipped. The subject has never explained the true meaning of the hourglass to the Chief.
"When the countdown ends, I hope you'll be well prepared..."
emotionCheck1:
[Tetra plays with the computers in your office.]

**Tetra:** Chief, you'd better watch out for the Bureau's network security.

**Chief:** ......

* **Prompt:** How about you help optimize the Bureau's network security logic?
 * **Tetra:** If you beg, I just might grant your wish.
 * **Tetra:** üòòüòâ

* **Prompt:** The Bureau's firewall is impeccable.
 * **Tetra:** Oh? Then whose file is this that I found on the computer?
 * **Tetra:** üòèüòèüòè
emotionCheck2:
[Tetra lies on the Bureau's document cabinet and sighs.]

**Tetra:** It's so boring. I didn't expect it would be so boring even here.

**Chief:** ......

* **Prompt:** How about you go find Pricilla?
 * **Tetra:** Tsk. Two people working together... Well, the missions will be too easy.
 * **Tetra:** üò•

* **Prompt:** Hmm. Should I prepare a solo mission for you?
 * **Tetra:** Oh? Now things are getting exciting. I like it.
 * **Tetra:** üòòüòâ
supervision1:
++* ‚ö† Button Thief

//Sinners' shirt buttons have been disappearing for no reason recently.//

**System Notifications:** The latest rumor among Sinners is about a ghost that only steals the middle button from shirts. As expected, you find a box full of buttons in the loot pile where Tetra often hangs out.

* **Prompt:** Punish with cleaning duty, and return the items to their rightful owners
supervision2:
++* ‚ö† Hacked

//The Bureau's database has been compromised.//

**System Notifications:** The internal database has been hacked. Tetra defends it in just fifteen minutes and locates the hacker.

* **Prompt:** Compliment then confiscate the action plan
supervision3:
++* ‚ö† Whispering

//Tetra and Pricilla seem to be plotting something.//

**System Notifications:** Tetra and Pricilla often whisper and point at you right in front of you. In reality, they are just discussing which brand of soda you prefer.

* **Prompt:** Actually, I prefer black tea.
baseVoicelines:
[Obtain the Sinner]
You actually invited a phantom robber inside... are you expecting me to steal something?

[Raise to Phase 1]
In these few seconds, I'll be watching you carefully.

[Raise to Phase 3]
When you catch up with time, you will feel that you can change everything.

[Level Start]
I already know the other side's plan like the back of my hand.

[Win Battles]
I planned this operation, so naturally it is foolproof.

[Lose Battles]
Time's up! Retreat!

[Ultimate Skill]
Time's up!

[Die in Battles]
Ha... in a way, that's also a type of escape.

[Greeting]
Hello, Chief of MBCC. Let me steal some of your time. Please, stop working for a moment. Let's have a chat?

[Conversation 1]
When time is frozen, this hourglass is the only timekeeping device that will keep on churning.

[Conversation 2]
The more constrained I am during the day... the wilder I am at night... hehe...

[Conversation 3]
Speaking of that little bunny... Don't you think she's interesting? But she leaves behind too many traces. Rather than have someone else catch her, it's better to... tie her to my side.

[Special Conversation 1]
I can trust my back entirely to Pricilla... Isn't it romantic?

[Special Conversation 2]
Whether it's Eastside or Paradeisos, under the glitzy facade, it's all chains and shackles.

[Special Conversation 3]
Even though I'm imprisoned here... this place is actually quite free.

[Full Compliance]
I already have the most precious thing in the world. Guess I'll... wash my hands of my old business, right now, in front of you.

[Idle]
Let times like these last a bit longer.

[Annoyed]
Are you seeking some thrills, Chief?

[Special Attention]
Don't blink! Be careful. This little fox's tricks can make you run around in circles.

[Dispatch]
I can complete your mission perfectly, but... would I do it?

[Dispatch Complete]
I got this gift for you along the way... Hmm? It doesn't count as a gift if it's stolen?

[Level Up]
Yes... there's room to improve.
attireVoicelines1:
[Attire Obtained]
Don't stand there like a fool! If we start running right now, we'll still have a chance to get the stolen treasure back from that bunny thief.

[Greeting]
Did I scare you with my entrance? But it's the fastest route... Besides, it's great fun to make a fuss at this hypocritical and flashy dinner party, isn't it?

[Ordinary Contact 1]
I have no interest in joining your field. I only volunteered to participate because I happened to discover their manhunt.

[Ordinary Contact 2]
Whoever sent that notice letter is clearly very confident, daringly leaving a trail of flower petals as her escape route... Is she secretly hoping to be caught?

[Idle] 
This direction... Ah, off to the terrace as expected. Care to guess why the security there is as loose as a breeze?

[Annoyed]
If you don't want to find something missing from your body later, behave yourself. Will ya, Chief?

[Special Attention] 
Stay close to me and I will keep you safe in this chaos.

[Level Up}
Everything is under control.
nightmareTalent: For each battle won, all allied units gain a 2%CRIT Rate boost. The boost is capped at 20%.

exclusiveCrimebrand.name: The Fox & The Righteous Robber
exclusiveCrimebrand.description: After Tetra uses [Instant Strike], her Ultimate becomes [Rewind], dealing (500%/600%/700% of Attack damage) Physical Damage to all enemies within range. She then returns to her previous location.
exclusiveCrimebrand.flavourText:
"My dear, it is so sad to see you all alone on that terrace. I brought along some friends with me."
"See you again then, if fate permits."

maniaIntensify.title: Hunting Hour
maniaIntensify.text: Upon breaking a Core, all allied Sinners gain 20% CRIT for 10 seconds.

guide.title: Ruby Panda build tips
guide.text: Boss Killing Tetra Vs Support Tetra: Skill for Boss Killing is 9911. Support is 1111 or 1117

crimebrandSets.name: Energy Damage
crimebrandSets.note: Boost energy generation, as well as CRIT rate and damage.

crimebrandSets.name: Energy
crimebrandSets.note: Standard set to boost energy generation.

crimebrandSets.name: Crit Alternative
crimebrandSets.note: An alternative to the Inversion Slash build. Less efficient, but still works.

crimebrandSets.name: Cheap Alternative
crimebrandSets.note: A cheap alternative to boost crit damage.

shackles.title: Standstill
shackles.description: After Tetra moves, the next Normal Attack will be guaranteed to be a CRIT hit.

shackles.title: Time Thief
shackles.description: When the enemy is stunned, Tetra gains a 20% Attack bonus for 5 seconds.

shackles.title: Emotion Resonance
shackles.description: Ultimate Energy Consumption is reduced by 3 points.

skills.name: Fox Trick
skills.description: Tetra attacks with her steel claws, dealing (100% of Attack damage) Physical Damage each time.

skills.name: Instant Strike
skills.description: Tetra moves to the target grid and attacks all enemies within range, dealing (500% of Attack damage) Physical Damage and 1 Core Damage.

skills.name: Split-second Blow
skills.description: Tetra gains 4% CRIT Rate bonus after using her Ultimate. The effect stacks up to 5 stacks and lasts until the end of the battle.

skills.name: Fox's Shadow
skills.description: Tetra's critical hits stun enemies for 2 seconds. The effect has a 20-second cooldown.

compliance: Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 1, Attack +6, Unlock Requirements: Use non-assistant Tetra's nirvana 30 times
Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 3, Unlock Requirements: Raise the level of Tetra to level 2
Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term, Unlock Sticker
Unlocking Data: Monitoring Records, Unlock Voice: Full Compliance, Unlock Sinner Title: Time slot fox light
supervision4:
++* ‚ö†‚ö† Lost Property

//There seems to be an unexpected visitor in your room.//

**System Notifications:** After a day's work, you prepare to return to your room to rest. But as you approach the door, you hear a rustling sound.

* **Prompt:** Open the door

**Chief:** Who's there?!

**System Notifications:** You see Tetra half hidden under your bed, rustling around for something.

**Tetra:** Sniff... sniff... Strange, it shouldn't be...

**Chief:** Cough cough...

**System Notifications:** Tetra tries to elegantly emerge from under your bed, but the long-neglected area leaves her with a gift: A head full of dust.

**Tetra:** Ah, Chief. Did my appearance shock you?

* **Prompt:** Respond calmly

**Chief:** Impressive, but I don't think Pippy would walk into a trap like that.

**Tetra:** Since you already know why I'm here, Chief, I suppose you would give me some help?

**Chief:** You want me to help you find [[[wolverine |Wolverine's]]] pet that you've "accidentally lost"?

**Chief:** Fine, but just so you know, even if you grab the animal, it won't give in easily.

**Tetra:** ...

**System Notifications:** Supervision System: Target confirmed. Location: Greenhouse.

**Chief:** When you return Pippy to Wolverine, remember to bring meat as an apology. Otherwise, you're not allowed to go out with Pricilla.

**Tetra:** Yes, yes, yes. Just don't think you've got the fox by the scruff now. After all, you're also a creature that can be snatched, Chief.
supervision5:
++* ‚ö†‚ö† Unveiling the Mystery

//Tetra seems to be spending a bit too much time familiarizing herself with the computer in the Training Room.//

**System Notifications:** Tetra occasionally practices her hacking skills in a corner of the Training Room, but today she seems to have not moved for a long time.

* **Prompt:** Speak up and ask

**Chief:** Something special happened?

**Tetra:** Hmm? How did you realize something was up? Is it because I'm usually quick? Or... have you been watching me for much longer than I thought?

* **Prompt:** What exactly happened?

**Tetra:** It's nothing serious. I was getting familiar with a new encryption method when I found an interesting onion on the Eastside's network.

**Chief:** Onion...?

**Tetra:** It looks like an ordinary private terminal, but it's wrapped in layers of the latest encryption methods.

**Tetra:** I was excited so I spent some time peeling them all off. And... it's just as I expected.

**System Notifications:** The screen shows the "core" of the onion, revealing that a well-known philanthropist in Eastside is actually laundering money through various projects.

**Tetra:** No matter how beautiful the skin is, once it's peeled off, all that's left is a rotten core.

supervision6:
++* ‚ö†‚ö†‚ö† Missing Prize

//There's been another theft and you need to solve it.//

**System Notifications:** Some of the gifts purchased by the logistics department for the celebration incident have been stolen. Please investigate promptly.

* **Prompt:** Ask Tetra

**Chief:** Do you have any leads on this?

**Tetra:** As soon as you hear something's missing, you come straight to me. You really have a lot of "trust" in me, Chief.

**Tetra:** Tell me, what are you looking for?

* **Prompt:** Check the lost items list

**Chief:** Four boxes of cream, six jars of large candies, ten sets of stationery...

**Tetra:** Hmm... Doesn't ring a bell. I've handled countless treasures, these little trinkets are far from memorable to me.

**Chief:** ...And twelve rabbit plush.

**Tetra:** Hmm... Wait, are you talking about that "Robber Rabbit" thing?

**Chief:** You remember now?

**Tetra:** Maybe. It's not every day you see a plush that fails so miserably at portraying the cool and cute bunny.

**Tetra:** I've gotten rid of them for you. You're welcome.

* **Prompt:** Demand her to return them
 * **Chief:** The event is about to start. You must return these prizes.
 * **Tetra:** I'm not lying, Chief, I really don't remember much.
 * **Tetra:** If you want to find these tacky things, you'll need to show off your excellent deductive abilities, Chief.
 * **Chief:** I'd rather spend that time on important matters.

* **Prompt:** Demand compensation
 * **Chief:** You need to compensate for the missing prizes.
